data.name: AppFullName
data.value: .NET Run Command

data.name: AppDescription
data.value: Command used to run .NET apps

data.name: CommandOptionNoBuildDescription
data.value: Do not build the project before running. Implies --no-restore.

data.name: CommandOptionFrameworkDescription
data.value: Build and run the app using the specified framework. The framework has to be specified in the project file.

data.name: CommandOptionProjectDescription
data.value: The path to the project file to run (defaults to the current directory if there is only one project).

data.name: CommandOptionLaunchProfileDescription
data.value: The name of the launch profile (if any) to use when launching the application.

data.name: CommandOptionNoLaunchProfileDescription
data.value: Do not attempt to use launchSettings.json to configure the application.

data.name: ConfigurationOptionDescription
data.value: The configuration to run for. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.

data.name: FrameworkOptionDescription
data.value: The target framework to run for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.

data.name: RuntimeOptionDescription
data.value: The target runtime to run for.

data.name: RunCommandBuilding
data.value: Building...

data.name: RunCommandException
data.value: The build failed. Fix the build errors and run again.

data.name: RunCommandExceptionUnableToRunSpecifyFramework
data.value: Unable to run your project Your project targets multiple frameworks. Specify which framework to run using '{0}'.

data.name: RunCommandExceptionUnableToRun
data.value: Unable to run your project. Ensure you have a runnable project type and ensure '{0}' supports this project. A runnable project should target a runnable TFM (for instance, net5.0) and have OutputType 'Exe'. The current {1} is '{2}'.

data.name: RunCommandExceptionNoProjects
data.value: Couldn't find a project to run. Ensure a project exists in {0}, or pass the path to the project using {1}.

data.name: RunCommandExceptionMultipleProjects
data.value: Specify which project file to use because {0} contains more than one project file.

data.name: RunCommandAdditionalArgsHelpText
data.value: Arguments passed to the application that is being run.

data.name: RunCommandExceptionCouldNotLocateALaunchSettingsFile
data.value: The specified launch profile could not be located.

data.name: RunCommandExceptionCouldNotApplyLaunchSettings
data.value: The launch profile "{0}" could not be applied. {1}

data.name: DefaultLaunchProfileDisplayName
data.value: (Default)

data.name: UsingLaunchSettingsFromMessage
data.value: Using launch settings from {0}...

data.name: LaunchProfileIsNotAJsonObject
data.value: A profile with the specified name could not be found or is not a valid JSON object.

data.name: LaunchProfileHandlerCannotBeLocated
data.value: The launch profile type '{0}' is not supported.

data.name: UsableLaunchProfileCannotBeLocated
data.value: A usable launch profile could not be located.

data.name: UnexpectedExceptionProcessingLaunchSettings
data.value: An unexpected exception occurred while processing launch settings: {0}

data.name: LaunchProfilesCollectionIsNotAJsonObject
data.value: The 'profiles' property of the launch settings document is not a JSON object.

data.name: DeserializationExceptionMessage
data.value: An error was encountered when reading launchSettings.json. {0}

data.name: RunCommandSpecifiecFileIsNotAValidProject
data.value: '{0}' is not a valid project file.

data.name: CouldNotConvertToBoolean
data.value: Could not convert the value of property '{0}' to a boolean.

data.name: CouldNotConvertToString
data.value: Could not convert the value of property '{0}' to a string.

data.name: ValueMustBeAnObject
data.value: The property '{0}' must be an object if it is specified.

data.name: RunCommandProjectAbbreviationDeprecated
data.value: Warning NETSDK1174: The abbreviation of -p for --project is deprecated. Please use --project.
